description: Amazon Redshift manages all the work of setting up, operating, and scaling a data warehouse: provisioning capacity, monitoring and backing up the cluster, and applying patches and upgrades to the Amazon Redshift engine.
steps: Log in or create new account
In the dropdown from your username, select 'My Security Credentials'
On the left side, select 'Groups' and create a new Group with the necessary polices
Create new user and assign to existing group
After creating user you will see credentials

blocks.name: authorizeSnapshotAccess
blocks.description: Authorizes the specified AWS customer account to restore the specified snapshot.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: accountWithRestoreAccess
args.info: The identifier of the AWS customer account authorized to restore the specified snapshot.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the snapshot the account is authorized to restore.

args.name: snapshotClusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

blocks.name: copyClusterSnapshot
blocks.description: Copies the specified automated cluster snapshot to a new manual cluster snapshot. The source must be an automated snapshot and it must be in the available state.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: sourceSnapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier for the source snapshot.

args.name: targetSnapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier given to the new manual snapshot.

args.name: sourceSnapshotClusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster the source snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

blocks.name: createCluster
blocks.description: Creates a new cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: A unique identifier for the cluster. You use this identifier to refer to the cluster for any subsequent cluster operations such as deleting or modifying. The identifier also appears in the Amazon Redshift console.

args.name: masterUsername
args.info: The user name associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created.

args.name: masterUserPassword
args.info: The password associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created.

args.name: nodeType
args.info: The node type to be provisioned for the cluster. For information about node types, go to Working with Clusters in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. Valid Values: ds1.xlarge; ds1.8xlarge; ds2.xlarge; ds2.8xlarge; dc1.large; dc1.8xlarge.

args.name: additionalInfo
args.info: Reserved

args.name: allowVersionUpgrade
args.info: If true, major version upgrades can be applied during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster. Default: true

args.name: automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
args.info: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with CreateClusterSnapshot. Default: 1

args.name: availabilityZone
args.info: The EC2 Availability Zone (AZ) in which you want Amazon Redshift to provision the cluster. For example, if you have several EC2 instances running in a specific Availability Zone, then you might want the cluster to be provisioned in the same zone in order to decrease network latency.

args.name: clusterParameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the parameter group to be associated with this cluster.

args.name: clusterSecurityGroups
args.info: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster. Default: The default cluster security group for Amazon Redshift.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name of a cluster subnet group to be associated with this cluster.

args.name: clusterType
args.info: The type of the cluster. Valid Values: multi-node; single-node. Default: multi-node

args.name: clusterVersion
args.info: The version of the Amazon Redshift engine software that you want to deploy on the cluster. Only version 1.0 is currently available.

args.name: dBName
args.info: The name of the first database to be created when the cluster is created.

args.name: elasticIp
args.info: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

args.name: encrypted
args.info: If true, the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest. Default: false.

args.name: enhancedVpcRouting
args.info: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. If this option is true, enhanced VPC routing is enabled. Default: false

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

args.name: iamRoles
args.info: A list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services. You must supply the IAM roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can supply up to 10 IAM roles in a single request.

args.name: kmsKeyId
args.info: The AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.

args.name: numberOfNodes
args.info: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. This parameter is required when the ClusterType parameter is specified as multi-node. Default 1

args.name: port
args.info: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections.

args.name: preferredMaintenanceWindow
args.info: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi. Valid Days: Mon; Tue; Wed; Thu; Fri; Sat; Sun

args.name: publiclyAccessible
args.info: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

args.name: vpcSecurityGroupIds
args.info: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createClusterParameterGroup
blocks.description: Creates an Amazon Redshift parameter group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: description
args.info: A description of the parameter group.

args.name: parameterGroupFamily
args.info: The Amazon Redshift engine version to which the cluster parameter group applies. The cluster engine version determines the set of parameters.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the cluster parameter group.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createClusterSnapshot
blocks.description: Creates a manual snapshot of the specified cluster. The cluster must be in the available state.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The cluster identifier for which you want a snapshot.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: A unique identifier for the snapshot that you are requesting. This identifier must be unique for all snapshots within the AWS account.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createClusterSubnetGroup
blocks.description: Creates a new Amazon Redshift subnet group. You must provide a list of one or more subnets in your existing Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) when creating Amazon Redshift subnet group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name for the subnet group. Amazon Redshift stores the value as a lowercase string.

args.name: description
args.info: A description for the subnet group.

args.name: subnetIds
args.info: An array of VPC subnet IDs. A maximum of 20 subnets can be modified in a single request.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createEventSubscription
blocks.description: Creates an Amazon Redshift event notification subscription

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: snsTopicArn
args.info: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic used to transmit the event notifications. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create a topic and subscribe to it.

args.name: subscriptionName
args.info: The name of the event subscription to be created.

args.name: enabled
args.info: A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription, set to false to create the subscription but not active it.

args.name: eventCategories
args.info: Specifies the Amazon Redshift event categories to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security

args.name: severity
args.info: Specifies the Amazon Redshift event severity to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: ERROR, INFO

args.name: sourceIds
args.info: A list of one or more identifiers of Amazon Redshift source objects. All of the objects must be of the same type as was specified in the source type parameter. The event subscription will return only events generated by the specified objects. If not specified, then events are returned for all objects within the source type specified.

args.name: sourceType
args.info: The type of source that will be generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a cluster, you would set this parameter to cluster. If this value is not specified, events are returned for all Amazon Redshift objects in your AWS account. You must specify a source type in order to specify source IDs. Valid values: cluster, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, and cluster-snapshot.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createHsmClientCertificate
blocks.description: Creates an HSM client certificate that an Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to the client's HSM in order to store and retrieve the keys used to encrypt the cluster databases.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: The identifier to be assigned to the new HSM client certificate that the cluster will use to connect to the HSM to use the database encryption keys.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createHsmConfiguration
blocks.description: Creates an HSM configuration that contains the information required by an Amazon Redshift cluster to store and use database encryption keys in a Hardware Security Module (HSM). After creating the HSM configuration, you can specify it as a parameter when creating a cluster. The cluster will then store its encryption keys in the HSM.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: description
args.info: A text description of the HSM configuration to be created.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: The identifier to be assigned to the new Amazon Redshift HSM configuration.

args.name: hsmIpAddress
args.info: The IP address that the Amazon Redshift cluster must use to access the HSM.

args.name: hsmPartitionName
args.info: The name of the partition in the HSM where the Amazon Redshift clusters will store their database encryption keys.

args.name: hsmPartitionPassword
args.info: The password required to access the HSM partition.

args.name: hsmServerPublicCertificate
args.info: The HSMs public certificate file. When using Cloud HSM, the file name is server.pem

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createSnapshotCopyGrant
blocks.description: Creates a snapshot copy grant that permits Amazon Redshift to use a customer master key (CMK) from AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) to encrypt copied snapshots in a destination region.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: snapshotCopyGrantName
args.info: The name of the snapshot copy grant. This name must be unique in the region for the AWS account.

args.name: kmsKeyId
args.info: The unique identifier of the customer master key (CMK) to which to grant Amazon Redshift permission. If no key is specified, the default key is used.

args.name: tags
args.info: A list of tag instances. See README for more details.

blocks.name: createTags
blocks.description: Adds one or more tags to a specified resource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceName
args.info: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to which you want to add the tag or tags. For example, arn:aws:redshift:us-east-1:123456789:cluster:t1.

args.name: tags
args.info: One or more name/value pairs to add as tags to the specified resource. Each tag name is passed in with the parameter Key and the corresponding value is passed in with the parameter Value.. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeClusterParameterGroups
blocks.description: Returns a list of Amazon Redshift parameter groups, including parameter groups you created and the default parameter group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of a specific parameter group for which to return details. By default, details about all parameter groups and the default parameter group are returned.

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified tag value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeClusterParameters
blocks.description: Returns a detailed list of parameters contained within the specified Amazon Redshift parameter group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of a cluster parameter group for which to return details.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

args.name: source
args.info: The parameter types to return. Specify user to show parameters that are different form the default. Similarly, specify engine-default to show parameters that are the same as the default parameter group. Default: All parameter types returned. Valid Values: user; engine-default

blocks.name: describeClusters
blocks.description: Returns properties of provisioned clusters including general cluster properties, cluster database properties, maintenance and backup properties, and security and access properties.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of a cluster whose properties you are requesting.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified tag value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeClusterSnapshots
blocks.description: Returns one or more snapshot objects, which contain metadata about your cluster snapshots.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster for which information about snapshots is requested.

args.name: endTime
args.info: A time value that requests only snapshots created at or before the specified time. The time value is specified in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2012-07-16T18:00:00Z

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

args.name: ownerAccount
args.info: The AWS customer account used to create or copy the snapshot. Use this field to filter the results to snapshots owned by a particular account. To describe snapshots you own, either specify your AWS customer account, or do not specify the parameter.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The snapshot identifier of the snapshot about which to return information.

args.name: snapshotType
args.info: The type of snapshots for which you are requesting information. By default, snapshots of all types are returned. Valid Values: automated; manual

args.name: startTime
args.info: A value that requests only snapshots created at or after the specified time. The time value is specified in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2012-07-16T18:00:00Z

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified tag value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeClusterSubnetGroups
blocks.description: Returns one or more cluster subnet group objects, which contain metadata about your cluster subnet groups.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name of the cluster subnet group for which information is requested.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching cluster parameter groups that are associated with the specified tag value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeClusterVersions
blocks.description: Returns descriptions of the available Amazon Redshift cluster versions.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterParameterGroupFamily
args.info: The name of a specific cluster parameter group family to return details for.

args.name: clusterVersion
args.info: The specific cluster version to return.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

blocks.name: describeDefaultClusterParameters
blocks.description: Returns a list of parameter settings for the specified parameter group family.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: parameterGroupFamily
args.info: The name of the cluster parameter group family.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. Default 100.

blocks.name: describeEventCategories
blocks.description: Displays a list of event categories for all event source types, or for a specified source type.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: sourceType
args.info: The source type, such as cluster or parameter group, to which the described event categories apply. Valid values: cluster, cluster-snapshot, cluster-parameter-group, and cluster-security-group.

blocks.name: describeEvents
blocks.description: Returns events related to clusters, security groups, snapshots, and parameter groups for the past 14 days.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: duration
args.info: The number of minutes prior to the time of the request for which to retrieve events. For example, if the request is sent at 18:00 and you specify a duration of 60, then only events which have occurred after 17:00 will be returned. Default: 60

args.name: endTime
args.info: The end of the time interval for which to retrieve events, specified in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: sourceIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the event source for which events will be returned. If this parameter is not specified, then all sources are included in the response.

args.name: sourceType
args.info: The event source to retrieve events for. If no value is specified, all events are returned.

args.name: startTime
args.info: The beginning of the time interval to retrieve events for, specified in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2009-07-08T18:00Z

blocks.name: describeEventSubscriptions
blocks.description: Lists descriptions of all the Amazon Redshift event notifications subscription for a customer account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: subscriptionName
args.info: The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription to be described.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

blocks.name: describeHsmClientCertificates
blocks.description: Returns information about the specified HSM client certificate. If no certificate ID is specified, returns information about all the HSM certificates owned by your AWS customer account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of a specific HSM client certificate for which you want information. If no identifier is specified, information is returned for all HSM client certificates owned by your AWS customer account.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

blocks.name: describeHsmConfigurations
blocks.description: Returns information about the specified Amazon Redshift HSM configuration. If no configuration ID is specified, returns information about all the HSM configurations owned by your AWS customer account.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of a specific Amazon Redshift HSM configuration to be described. If no identifier is specified, information is returned for all HSM configurations owned by your AWS customer account.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching HSM configurations that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching HSM configurations that are associated with the specified tag value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeLoggingStatus
blocks.description: Describes whether information, such as queries and connection attempts, is being logged for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster from which to get the logging status.

blocks.name: describeOrderableClusterOptions
blocks.description: Returns a list of orderable cluster options. Before you create a new cluster you can use this operation to find what options are available, such as the EC2 Availability Zones (AZ) in the specific AWS region that you can specify, and the node types you can request.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterVersion
args.info: The version filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings matching the specified version. Default: All versions.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: nodeType
args.info: The node type filter value. Specify this parameter to show only the available offerings matching the specified node type.

blocks.name: describeReservedNodeOfferings
blocks.description: Returns a list of the available reserved node offerings by Amazon Redshift with their descriptions including the node type, the fixed and recurring costs of reserving the node and duration the node will be reserved for you.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: reservedNodeOfferingId
args.info: The unique identifier for the offering.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

blocks.name: describeReservedNodes
blocks.description: Returns the descriptions of the reserved nodes.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: reservedNodeId
args.info: Identifier for the node reservation.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

blocks.name: describeResize
blocks.description: Returns information about the last resize operation for the specified cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of a cluster whose resize progress you are requesting. This parameter is case-sensitive. By default, resize operations for all clusters defined for an AWS account are returned.

blocks.name: describeSnapshotCopyGrants
blocks.description: Returns a list of snapshot copy grants owned by the AWS account in the destination region.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: snapshotCopyGrantName
args.info: The name of the snapshot copy grant.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching resources that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching resources that are associated with the specified value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: describeTableRestoreStatus
blocks.description: Lists the status of one or more table restore requests made using the RestoreTableFromClusterSnapshot API action.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The Amazon Redshift cluster that the table is being restored to.

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: tableRestoreRequestId
args.info: The identifier of the table restore request to return status for. If you don't specify a TableRestoreRequestId value, then DescribeTableRestoreStatus returns the status of all in-progress table restore requests.

blocks.name: describeTags
blocks.description: Returns a list of tags. You can return tags from a specific resource by specifying an ARN, or you can return all tags for a given type of resource, such as clusters, snapshots, and so on.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceName
args.info: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for which you want to describe the tag or tags. For example, arn:aws:redshift:us-east-1:123456789:cluster:t1.

args.name: resourceType
args.info: The type of resource with which you want to view tags. Valid resource types are: Cluster, CIDR/IP, EC2 security group, Snapshot, Cluster security group, Subnet group, HSM connection, HSM certificate, Parameter group, Snapshot copy grant

args.name: marker
args.info: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point to return a set of response records. When the results of a request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, AWS returns a value in the Marker field of the response.

args.name: maxRecords
args.info: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in a marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of records by retrying the command with the returned marker value. Default: 100

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: A tag key or keys for which you want to return all matching resources that are associated with the specified key or keys. See README for more details.

args.name: tagValues
args.info: A tag value or values for which you want to return all matching resources that are associated with the specified value or values. See README for more details.

blocks.name: disableLogging
blocks.description: Stops logging information, such as queries and connection attempts, for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be stopped.

blocks.name: disableSnapshotCopy
blocks.description: Disables the automatic copying of snapshots from one region to another region for a specified cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the source cluster that you want to disable copying of snapshots to a destination region.

blocks.name: enableLogging
blocks.description: Starts logging information, such as queries and connection attempts, for the specified Amazon Redshift cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: The name of an existing S3 bucket where the log files are to be stored.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be started.

args.name: s3KeyPrefix
args.info: The prefix applied to the log file names.

blocks.name: enableSnapshotCopy
blocks.description: Enables the automatic copy of snapshots from one region to another region for a specified cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster on which logging is to be started.

args.name: destinationRegion
args.info: The destination region that you want to copy snapshots to.

args.name: retentionPeriod
args.info: The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are copied from the source region. Default: 7.

args.name: snapshotCopyGrantName
args.info: The name of the snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an AWS KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination region.

blocks.name: modifyCluster
blocks.description: Modifies the settings for a cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the cluster to be modified.

args.name: allowVersionUpgrade
args.info: If true, major version upgrades will be applied automatically to the cluster during the maintenance window. Default: false

args.name: automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
args.info: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with CreateClusterSnapshot. Default: 1

args.name: clusterParameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the cluster parameter group to apply to this cluster.

args.name: clusterSecurityGroups
args.info: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster.

args.name: clusterType
args.info: The type of the cluster. Valid Values: multi-node; single-node. Default: multi-node

args.name: clusterVersion
args.info: The new version number of the Amazon Redshift engine to upgrade to.

args.name: elasticIp
args.info: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

args.name: enhancedVpcRouting
args.info: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide. If this option is true, enhanced VPC routing is enabled. Default: false

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

args.name: masterUserPassword
args.info: The new password for the cluster master user.

args.name: newClusterIdentifier
args.info: The new identifier for the cluster.

args.name: nodeType
args.info: The new node type of the cluster. If you specify a new node type, you must also specify the number of nodes parameter. Valid Values: ds1.xlarge; ds1.8xlarge; ds2.xlarge; ds2.8xlarge; dc1.large; dc1.8xlarge.

args.name: numberOfNodes
args.info: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. This parameter is required when the ClusterType parameter is specified as multi-node. Default 1

args.name: preferredMaintenanceWindow
args.info: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi. Valid Days: Mon; Tue; Wed; Thu; Fri; Sat; Sun

args.name: publiclyAccessible
args.info: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

args.name: vpcSecurityGroupIds
args.info: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster. See README for more details.

blocks.name: modifyClusterIamRoles
blocks.description: Modifies the list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the cluster for which you want to associate or disassociate IAM roles.

args.name: addIamRoles
args.info: Array of strings. Zero or more IAM roles to associate with the cluster. The roles must be in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can associate up to 10 IAM roles with a single cluster in a single request. See README for more details.

args.name: removeIamRoles
args.info: Array of strings. Zero or more IAM roles in ARN format to disassociate from the cluster. You can disassociate up to 10 IAM roles from a single cluster in a single request. See README for more details.

blocks.name: modifyClusterParameterGroup
blocks.description: Modifies the parameters of a parameter group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the parameter group to be modified.

args.name: parameters
args.info: Array of objects. An array of parameters to be modified. A maximum of 20 parameters can be modified in a single request. For each parameter to be modified, you must supply at least the parameter name and parameter value; other name-value pairs of the parameter are optional. See README for more details.

blocks.name: modifyClusterSubnetGroup
blocks.description: Modifies a cluster subnet group to include the specified list of VPC subnets. The operation replaces the existing list of subnets with the new list of subnets.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name of the subnet group to be modified.

args.name: subnetIds
args.info: Array of strings. An array of VPC subnet IDs. A maximum of 20 subnets can be modified in a single request. See README for more details.

args.name: description
args.info: A text description of the subnet group to be modified.

blocks.name: modifyEventSubscription
blocks.description: Modifies an existing Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: subscriptionName
args.info: The name of the modified Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

args.name: enabled
args.info: A Boolean value indicating if the subscription is enabled. true indicates the subscription is enabled

args.name: eventCategories
args.info: Array of strings. Specifies the Amazon Redshift event categories to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: Configuration, Management, Monitoring, Security. See README for more details.

args.name: severity
args.info: Specifies the Amazon Redshift event severity to be published by the event notification subscription. Values: ERROR, INFO

args.name: snsTopicArn
args.info: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to be used by the event notification subscription.

args.name: sourceIds
args.info: Array of strings. A list of one or more identifiers of Amazon Redshift source objects. All of the objects must be of the same type as was specified in the source type parameter. The event subscription will return only events generated by the specified objects. If not specified, then events are returned for all objects within the source type specified. Example: my-cluster-1, my-cluster-2, my-snapshot-20131010. See README for more details.

args.name: sourceType
args.info: The type of source that will be generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a cluster, you would set this parameter to cluster. If this value is not specified, events are returned for all Amazon Redshift objects in your AWS account. You must specify a source type in order to specify source IDs. Valid values: cluster, cluster-parameter-group, cluster-security-group, and cluster-snapshot.

blocks.name: modifySnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod
blocks.description: Modifies the number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are copied from the source region.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the cluster for which you want to change the retention period for automated snapshots that are copied to a destination region.

args.name: retentionPeriod
args.info: The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are copied from the source region. Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.

blocks.name: purchaseReservedNodeOffering
blocks.description: Allows you to purchase reserved nodes. Amazon Redshift offers a predefined set of reserved node offerings. You can purchase one or more of the offerings. You can call the DescribeReservedNodeOfferings API to obtain the available reserved node offerings. You can call this API by providing a specific reserved node offering and the number of nodes you want to reserve.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: reservedNodeOfferingId
args.info: The unique identifier of the reserved node offering you want to purchase.

args.name: nodeCount
args.info: The number of reserved nodes that you want to purchase. Default: 1

blocks.name: rebootCluster
blocks.description: Reboots a cluster. This action is taken as soon as possible. It results in a momentary outage to the cluster, during which the cluster status is set to rebooting. A cluster event is created when the reboot is completed. Any pending cluster modifications (see ModifyCluster) are applied at this reboot.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The cluster identifier.

blocks.name: resetClusterParameterGroup
blocks.description: Sets one or more parameters of the specified parameter group to their default values and sets the source values of the parameters to "engine-default". To reset the entire parameter group specify the ResetAllParameters parameter.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the cluster parameter group to be reset.

args.name: parameters
args.info: An array of names of parameters to be reset. If ResetAllParameters option is not used, then at least one parameter name must be supplied. Constraints: A maximum of 20 parameters can be reset in a single request.

args.name: resetAllParameters
args.info: If true, all parameters in the specified parameter group will be reset to their default values. Default: true

blocks.name: restoreFromClusterSnapshot
blocks.description: Creates a new cluster from a snapshot. By default, Amazon Redshift creates the resulting cluster with the same configuration as the original cluster from which the snapshot was created, except that the new cluster is created with the default cluster security and parameter groups.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster that will be created from restoring the snapshot.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The name of the snapshot from which to create the new cluster. This parameter isn't case sensitive.

args.name: additionalInfo
args.info: Reserved

args.name: allowVersionUpgrade
args.info: If true, major version upgrades can be applied during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster. Default: true

args.name: automatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
args.info: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Even if automated snapshots are disabled, you can still create manual snapshots when you want with CreateClusterSnapshot. Default: The value selected for the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.

args.name: availabilityZone
args.info: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone in which to restore the cluster. Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone. Example: us-east-1a

args.name: clusterParameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the parameter group to be associated with this cluster.

args.name: clusterSecurityGroups
args.info: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster. Default: The default cluster security group for Amazon Redshift. See README for more details.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name of the subnet group where you want to cluster restored.

args.name: elasticIp
args.info: The elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

args.name: enhancedVpcRouting
args.info: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. Default: false

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

args.name: iamRoles
args.info: A list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services. You must supply the IAM roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can supply up to 10 IAM roles in a single request. See README for more details.

args.name: kmsKeyId
args.info: The AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you want to use to encrypt data in the cluster that you restore from a shared snapshot.

args.name: nodeType
args.info: The node type that the restored cluster will be provisioned with.

args.name: ownerAccount
args.info: The AWS customer account used to create or copy the snapshot. Required if you are restoring a snapshot you do not own, optional if you own the snapshot.

args.name: port
args.info: The port number on which the cluster accepts connections. Default: The same port as the original cluster.

args.name: preferredMaintenanceWindow
args.info: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur. Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi. Valid Days: Mon; Tue; Wed; Thu; Fri; Sat; Sun

args.name: publiclyAccessible
args.info: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

args.name: snapshotClusterIdentifier
args.info: The name of the cluster the source snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

args.name: vpcSecurityGroupIds
args.info: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster. See README for more details.

blocks.name: restoreTableFromClusterSnapshot
blocks.description: Creates a new table from a table in an Amazon Redshift cluster snapshot. You must create the new table within the Amazon Redshift cluster that the snapshot was taken from.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the Amazon Redshift cluster to restore the table to.

args.name: newTableName
args.info: The name of the table to create as a result of the current request.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the snapshot to restore the table from. This snapshot must have been created from the Amazon Redshift cluster specified by the ClusterIdentifier parameter.

args.name: sourceDatabaseName
args.info: The name of the source database that contains the table to restore from.

args.name: sourceTableName
args.info: The name of the source table to restore from.

args.name: sourceSchemaName
args.info: The name of the source schema that contains the table to restore from. If you do not specify a SourceSchemaName value, the default is public.

args.name: targetDatabaseName
args.info: The name of the database to restore the table to.

args.name: targetSchemaName
args.info: The name of the schema to restore the table to.

blocks.name: revokeSnapshotAccess
blocks.description: Removes the ability of the specified AWS customer account to restore the specified snapshot. If the account is currently restoring the snapshot, the restore will run to completion.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: accountWithRestoreAccess
args.info: The identifier of the AWS customer account that can no longer restore the specified snapshot.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the snapshot that the account can no longer access.

args.name: snapshotClusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

blocks.name: rotateEncryptionKey
blocks.description: Rotates the encryption keys for a cluster.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the cluster that you want to rotate the encryption keys for.

blocks.name: deleteTags
blocks.description: Deletes a tag or tags from a resource. You must provide the ARN of the resource from which you want to delete the tag or tags.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: resourceName
args.info: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from which you want to remove the tag or tags. For example, arn:aws:redshift:us-east-1:123456789:cluster:t1.

args.name: tagKeys
args.info: Array of strings. The tag key that you want to delete. See README for more details.

blocks.name: deleteSnapshotCopyGrant
blocks.description: Deletes the specified snapshot copy grant.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: snapshotCopyGrantName
args.info: The name of the snapshot copy grant to delete.

blocks.name: deleteHsmConfiguration
blocks.description: Deletes the specified snapshot copy grant.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: hsmConfigurationIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the Amazon Redshift HSM configuration to be deleted.

blocks.name: deleteHsmClientCertificate
blocks.description: Deletes the specified HSM client certificate.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: hsmClientCertificateIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the HSM client certificate to be deleted.

blocks.name: deleteEventSubscription
blocks.description: Deletes an Amazon Redshift event notification subscription.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: subscriptionName
args.info: The name of the Amazon Redshift event notification subscription to be deleted.

blocks.name: deleteClusterSubnetGroup
blocks.description: Deletes the specified cluster subnet group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterSubnetGroupName
args.info: The name of the cluster subnet group name to be deleted.

blocks.name: deleteClusterSnapshot
blocks.description: Deletes the specified cluster subnet group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: snapshotIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the manual snapshot to be deleted.

args.name: snapshotClusterIdentifier
args.info: The unique identifier of the cluster the snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

blocks.name: deleteClusterParameterGroup
blocks.description: Deletes a specified Amazon Redshift parameter group.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: parameterGroupName
args.info: The name of the parameter group to be deleted.

blocks.name: deleteCluster
blocks.description: Deletes a previously provisioned cluster. A successful response from the web service indicates that the request was received correctly.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: API secret obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Region.

args.name: clusterIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the cluster to be deleted.

args.name: finalClusterSnapshotIdentifier
args.info: The identifier of the final snapshot that is to be created immediately before deleting the cluster. If this parameter is provided, SkipFinalClusterSnapshot must be false.

args.name: skipFinalClusterSnapshot
args.info: Determines whether a final snapshot of the cluster is created before Amazon Redshift deletes the cluster. If true, a final cluster snapshot is not created. If false, a final cluster snapshot is created before the cluster is deleted. Default: false
